WorkItem.ClosedComment: Gemming templates are updated in the next release.
WorkItem.Description:
Here are my char sheet and elitistjerks spreadsheet.  The spreadsheet seems to recommend all AP gems with some haste while rawr seems to recommend all agility gems with some crit (and weirdly a agi/stam gem for chest).
Â 
I haven't modeled some of my gear in the spreadsheet, I have some heroic level gear that isn't included as a choice.
WorkItem.Summary: [Rogue] difference in rogue gem recommendations with EJ spreadsheet

Comments.Message: Yay, more work for me. Going to look into it!

The Rawr file you posted is not the same as the char in the sheet, 2 examples of items that are different are the Neck and 1st Ring.
If you still see the discrepancy when you have a sheet that's exactly the same as the Rawr file please post them so I can look into this (if some of your items are not in the sheet just change the Rawr char and compare them then).
Here you go, I changed my rawr profile to match the spreadsheet.  Bold gems don't even show up as an option on the Comparisons side, had to equip the one manually.
Thanks, going to check it tomorrow.

You have the Bright (40 AP), Stark (40 AP and 10 Haste) and Quick (20 Haste) gems turned off in comparisons, which Rawr also gives a warning for when you're trying to optimize.

Turn these on and you'll see that Rawr suggests almost the same gemming as the spreadsheet, the only difference is the chest where Rawr grabs the 8 Agi socket bonus and the spreadsheet doesn't. That Rawr does it is not weird because you need a blue gem to activate your meta gem which is not activated in your spreadsheet.

Another thing is that the talent build is completely different between the 2. The Rawr file has a PvP build while the spreadsheet has a PvE build.

sorry about that, must have had my pvp gear on and didn't notice.  Just looked at the pieces that I knew were different and compared gems.

Why are those gems turned off in comparison?  Is that default?

As they're common Rogue gems they should be in the standard gemming templates but I did not update those yet.
The best thing to do at the moment is to enable any gems you want Rawr to consider yourself.
I'm going to leave this open as a reminder to myself to sort those gemming templates.
